"If you think you are too small to make an impact, try sleeping with a mosquito in the room" - African proverb

About

My name is José Luis Pérez. I am curious by nature and I enjoy learning and researching topics mainly related to cybersecurity and hardware hacking.

My hobbies are computer science, photography and nature. I like to share knowledge and meet new people willing to create community and share experiences.

That’s me, well, a summary of me ;)

Career

  • October 2017 - Currently

    Technician in computer support to client

    I believe that this position has been one of my first experiences in a larger business infrastructure, the fact of working with a wide range of technologies both private and free has made me learn to adapt to the multiple environments of each client and solve any problem that appears in the shortest time possible.

  • July 2016 - July 2017

    Computer Security Auditor Jr

    A really challenging job, every job I received was way above my knowledge and one of the most important knowledge acquired here was the ability to learn from Self-taught way to give solution to those problems.

  • June 2015 - March 2016

    Computer troubleshooting service at home

    A work completely close to friends and acquaintances, totally based on customer satisfaction.

  • January 2015- July 2015

    Internship as Technician in Electronic Repairs

    A demanding job that required a high level of resolution to any inconvenience and unforeseen that arose during the repair of both towers or laptops (Windows or Mac) and tablets, mobile phones or video game consoles.
